title.narrative: Ministry of Defense Advisors Program

description.narrative: The Ministry of Defense Advisors (MoDA) program partners senior Department of Defense (DoD) civilian experts with foreign counterparts to improve ministerial capacity. A MoDA is assisting the Iraqi Ministry of Defense with defense planning reform initiatives. Long-term defense capacity building objectives are being achieved.

title.narrative: Ministry of Defense Advisors Program (MODA)

description.narrative: The Ministry of Defense Advisors (MoDA) program partners senior Department of Defense (DoD) civilian experts with foreign counterparts to improve ministerial capacity. The MoDA Program assists the Iraqi Ministries of Defense and Interior with various ministerial reform initiatives. Long-term reform objectives are being achieved.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

Department of Defense, Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide

title.narrative: Iraq Train and Equip Fund (ITEF)

description.narrative: The Iraq Train and Equip Fund (ITEF) supports the military and other security forces of or associated with the Government of Iraq operations against the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant. Appropriated funds enable DOD to provide assistance, including training, equipment, logistics support, supplies, and services, stipends, facility and infrastructure repair and renovation, and sustainment.

title.narrative: U.S. Department of Defense, Institutional Capacity Building Programs: Defense Institution Reform Initiative

description.narrative: Iraq - Logistics Engagement #4. Collaborate with Office of Security Cooperation-Iraq, Combined Joint Task Force Operation Inherent Resolve, and the Iraqi Ministry of Defense M4 to plan supply chain mapping for CL IX repair parts and CL V ammunition. Create a 12-month tasks agenda for CY20. Exchange information with ARCENT to review their ability to receive, process, and deliver repair parts for maintenance to support Iraqi Security Forces (ISF) materiel readiness requirements, and to review ammo shipment timelines to support ISF training readiness requirements.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of Defense, Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide
Department of Defense, Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide

title.narrative: U.S. Department of Defense, Institutional Capacity Building Programs: Defense Institution Reform Initiative

description.narrative: Iraq - Strategic Planning/Force Structure #7/Logistics #3. Conduct a series of engagements with the Iraqi Counter Terrorism Service (ICTS) to introduce comprehensive security concepts and whole-of-government approaches to initiate an effort to develop ministerial capacity to create and implement strategy. Support execution of the NATO Defense Capacity Building Force Structure Working Group.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: U.S. Department of Defense, Institutional Capacity Building Programs: Defense Institution Reform Initiative

description.narrative: Iraq - Strategic Planning/Force Structure #8. Collaborate with Office of Security Cooperation-Iraq, NATO Mission Iraq (NMI), the Iraq Ministry of Defense (MoD) M5, and the Iraqi Counter Terrorism Service (ICTS) to conduct readiness baselining activities to launch readiness reforms in accordance with the recommendation of the Iraqi MoD Reform Committee. Develop an agenda for a 3-day Readiness Conference to be executed in October 2019 in support of the MoD and the Iraqi service components. Support execution of the NATO Defense Capacity Building Force Structure Working Group.

title.narrative: Iraq Security Forces Fund

description.narrative: This program finances the cost of developing effective Iraqi Military and Police Forces that can take control of security operations within Iraq's borders, stabilize the country, and reduce the insurgency to a level that enables democracy to grow and U.S. forces to return home. Funding supports a broad spectrum of activities to include training individuals, advising and mentoring units, equipping individuals with uniforms, weapons, and body armor, equipping units with vehicles, communications gear, and crew served weapons, developing the logistics and maintenance support structure to sustain units, providing basing and facility infrastructure, and improving ministerial capacity to keep the forces operating after the U.S. departs.

title.narrative: Task Force for Business and Stability Operations (TFBSO) Support (OCO-funded): Miscellaneous Support Services.

description.narrative: TFBSO Miscellaneous Projects - FY2007 funds. Implementing Partner: Enterprise - United States Unknown. The Task Force for Business and Stability Operations (TFBSO) was formed by the U.S. Department of Defense to leverage American international economic power as a strategic tool for promoting economic stabilization and security. TFBSO creates opportunities for Afghanistan and works with global private sector firms as the nation rebuilds its economy, infrastructure and government.
